description:
Job title: Senior Sales Account Manager

Location: Michigan OR Tennessee

About the client and role

The Account Manager promotes products and capabilities in order to cultivate new business; coordinates customer programs and the actions needed to define, develop, and produce the required product; and communicates business opportunities, issues, and status to other members and departments in order to meet customer expectations and achieve goals.

Responsibilities (listed if required)
• Develop and maintain contacts and relationships with potential and existing customers
• Obtains and processes RFQ requirements
• Receives and verifies customer purchase orders
• Routine commercial and technical Interaction with automotive manufacturers, including international and service entities.
• Visits to the engineering, purchasing, and manufacturing sites of assigned automotive manufacturers.
• Provide technical assistance in systematic problem-solving initiatives; communicate and/or collaborate with internal departments/Customer as necessary.
• Identify, develop and prepare quotations for new business opportunities and/or to reflect product design evolution.
• Ensure preparation of documentation and/or reports are completed as required (NAFTA, AALA, CAFÉ, etc.)
• Lead project management to communicate and ensure customer timelines are met.
• Negotiate and/or assist in resolving customer issues (pricing quality etc.).
• Develop and implement strategic plans, sales forecasts, marketing plans and materials etc. required to effectively and profitably grow assigned customers.
• Review and monitor product development activities to ensure that the customer’s expectations are met and/or exceeded.
• Document and report as appropriate, sales results, requirements, market trends, variances etc.

Skills and Qualifications
• Previous experience in negotiating with purchasing and/or engineering departments is preferred.
• Project management experience is desired.
• Experience in dealing with GM, Ford, Chrysler or Toyota and a good understanding of their related processes/systems (SSTS, SDS, SOR, SOW etc), including their APQP process is desired.
• Knowledge/Understanding / Experience with vehicle systems and/or vehicle sub systems (steering, driveline or vehicle dynamics preferred).
• Ability to work in a team-oriented / multi-cultural environment utilizing effective interpersonal skills. • Superior analytical, problem solving skills.
• Excellent communication/presentation skills, written and verbal.
• High degree of initiative, with ability to make decisions.
• Ability to prioritize and deal with multiple assignments simultaneously.
• Knowledge of personal computers and related software, including MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

About CLM

At CLM, we’re obsessed with creating a better executive search experience for our candidates and clients in the automotive industry. With over 25 years of international experience providing staffing solutions at C-Suite, Leadership and Management level, we go above and beyond to ensure your needs always come first.

Unfortunately, due to the high level of applications, we are not physically able to get back to every candidate that applies. Please follow our CLM page for regular job updates and we hope to support you with your next venture.
